qas.question: What day did Truman mandate the end of discrimination in the federal government?
How many executive orders were issued to help prevent discrimination?
What was the name given to Executive Order 9980?

answers.text: Regulations Governing for Employment Practices within the Federal Establishment

qas.question: Which position was formulated as a result of Executive Order 9980?
What name was given to Executive Order 9981?

answers.text: Establishing the President's Committee on Equality of Treatment and Opportunity in the Armed Services

qas.question: What day did Truman mandate the beginning of discrimination in the federal government?
How many executive orders were issued to help provide discrimination?

plausible_answers.text: Regulations Governing for Employment Practices within the Federal Establishment

qas.question: What was the name given to Executive Order 9180?
Which position was formulated as a result of Executive Order 9?

plausible_answers.text: Establishing the President's Committee on Equality of Treatment and Opportunity in the Armed Services

qas.question: What name was given to Executive Order 9181?

context: On <a0_0>July 26<a0_0/>, Truman mandated the end of hiring and employment discrimination in the federal government, reaffirming FDR's order of 1941.:40 He issued <a1_0><b6_0>two<b6_0/><a1_0/> executive orders on <b5_0>July 26<b5_0/>, 1948: Executive Order 9980 and Executive Order 9981. Executive Order 9980, named <a2_0><b7_0>Regulations Governing for Employment Practices within the Federal Establishment<b7_0/><a2_0/>, instituted fair employment practices in the civilian agencies of the federal government. The order created the position of <a3_0><b8_0>Fair Employment Officer<b8_0/><a3_0/>. The order "established in the Civil Service Commission a Fair Employment Board of not less than seven persons." Executive Order 9981, named <a4_0><b9_0>Establishing the President's Committee on Equality of Treatment and Opportunity in the Armed Services<b9_0/><a4_0/>, called for the integration of the Armed Forces and the creation of the National Military Establishment to carry out the executive order.
